intro: Lindenbergia scutellarioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lindenbergia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
